comments.text:
That looks like a danger dylan video. 

That is one of a great many youtubers that makes money by basicly grabbing 
all kinds of useless trivia, and putting them together in "Top 10" videos 
that make for interesting material for people to view.
Such videos bug me, not only because they further encourage viewers not to 
check anything further, but also because "top 10" is arbitrary. Top 10, 
according to who?

And of course you have to remember that youtube is filled with the common 
people, and the common misconceptions (known or unknown). 

I know about this video, amoung others by DD (and others by other such 
youtubers) because I see a fair bot of them with friends. 
I swear I have spent hours at the coffee shop starring at an iPhone 
watching (or trying to tune out) either top 10 vids, car crash 
compilations, viral marketing campaigns or conspiricy dreck that even you 
would shake your head at. 

Its all useless filler, but some of it masquarading as useful information. 
Good for passive consumption, but dangerous when swallowed in mass. 

As for the misandry in the posted video, it would surprise me if the 
creator even know that when making it.

+Victor Torres "Most serial killers are real life geniuses."

That's total bullshit. Gary Ridgway had an IQ of 82. Ottis Toole had an IQ 
of 75. Henry Lee Lucas' IQ was 84. There have been serial killers with 
above average IQs of course (Ed Kemper and Ted Bundy are a couple of 
obvious examples), but most are probably around the average range just like 
most of the general population.

Crocodiles and lions are incredible predators, but they are hardly the most 
intelligent animals. What makes you an effective predator and what makes 
you a great philosopher, scientist, or engineer are not necessarily the 
same type of intellectual abilities.

comments.text:
+thecreator625 That's a little contradictory "A child taken away from the 
parents unless they are truly abusive is the worst thing one can do"
When your argument is that a spank is truly abusive. 
And as you have no true experience with kids, then you can't say how they 
act. There are kids out there who do not care what you say and will go 
against you for the sake of it. Even after talking, warning, raising your 
voice, and even after spanking. 
It's not often you would actually come across someone who smacks their 
child as soon as something happens. There will always be a few warnings.
comments.author: Anna Jordan

comments.text:
+Moofupi
How come I was able to take care of my little cousins just fine then? I've 
seen them very frequently, so I daresay I am strongly familiar with them.
(Also, you shouldn't yell. All it does is, just like spanking, incite fear 
at a certain volume and show you have troubles upholding authority without 
using it.)
By the way... kids don't become afraid of the consequences alone. They 
become afraid of the person as well. This isn't always obvious, as your 
child won't quake in fear from just a couple times spanking, but it WILL 
make the kid wary about you and feel MUCH less at home, Eventually, they 
too will most likely say that the spanking was alright, it's a normal 
psychological defense mechanism to cope with it and the fact the parents 
were abusive, even if just mildly.
Of course, educational measures aren't abuse, yet something like spanking 
by no means can be justified as such. You wanna know how I am able to keep 
my cousins on a leash when it's needed? They look up to me as a person. 
I've been a role-model for them ever since. They respect me without me 
having to use any authority whatsoever. There's a major difference between 
having authority and using authority.

Think of a good teacher and a bad teacher. A teacher supposedly is an 
authority figure for the child and has some rights in terms of educational 
measures, though these are linked only to school. Some teachers just are 
able to keep a class's attention, some aren't. Thinking back at my school 
time, I've had some teachers that had no trouble whatsoever getting back a 
class's attention whilst others just couldn't. Same deal with parents. 
Spanking is no go-to excuse because you can't deal. I know quite a few 
people that would never be able to raise a child... and I'm more than happy 
most of them actually don't plan to.

Kids are kids and by nature, test the boundaries of rules. Which is a good 
thing and something many simply forget to do when they grow up. They are 
gonna break boundaries, that much is obvious and to be expected. They are 
gonna break rules in the process, some of which don't make sense, some of 
which can be forgiven. Is either of that a reason to spank a child?

In Finnland, your child can get taken away  even just at the rumour you 
might have spanked your child... it's right that spanking is just wrong, 
but that IS a little bit extreme. However still a true approach. I 
personally would rather have them attend parental training. A child taken 
away from the parents unless they are truly abusive is the worst thing one 
can do.
comments.author: thecreator625

comments.text:
+thecreator625 If they are not familiar with you, they will listen. If they 
know you and know the only thing you would do is yell, of course they're 
not going to listen. Sometimes to make children afraid of the consequences 
works.
comments.author: Moofupi

maintain it. Spanking as a "go-to excuse" is not legit.

comments.text:
+H Ritter Thank you! I'm glad I could help. :) I think you are absolutely 
right. I've actually gotten a lot softer and more understanding of 
psychopaths and sociopaths after hearing their stories. Their problems 
start as children and their stories are heartbreaking as they and their 
families routinely go without care, medicine, education, and safety trying 
to deal with their psychosis. It's NOT their faults that they are the way 
they are. 

I am 100% aware of how extremely dangerous these men are, but we as a 
society have really shirked our responsibilities towards the mentally ill. 
Prison is not a substitute for asylums, medicine, study, and education. And 
until we as a society stop being lazy and selfish and start taking care of 
our own, we're never going to see a reduction in crime and violence. 

As for the emotional binding of boys and men...nowhere will you find a more 
stark example of how damaging this is than prison. We brutalize men and 
boys, deny them compassion to toughen them up and make them hard, and 
prevent them from being allowed to express themselves with anything other 
than anger...and we WONDER why some turn into dangerous violent cons? 

Everyone is responsible for their own actions...but that doesn't mean 
society isn't lazy and selfish and shirking its responsibilities to it's 
members.

comments.text:
From my experience working in the local courts as a transcriptionist and 
hearing a great deal from clinical psychologists called in for expert 
testimony in cases of clinical sociopathy and psychopathy, I concur with 
what people have said that that it seems to be something to do with male 
biology in cases like that. Generally every psychologist mentioned that 
they didn't know absolutely for certain why these kinds of traits are more 
prevalent in men, just that they seem to have found a link between the 
genetics of men that may make males far more prone to these diseases. Often 
chronically violent men have trouble with testosterone and hormone issues 
and they tend to calm down when chemically castrated or with use of other 
drugs that help even out their fluctuations. 

This has no inherent meaning on how we should consider men as a gender. 
It's not bashing them to talk about it. There are a LOT of diseases that 
only men or only women get. Like thyroid problems for example tend to show 
up much, much more commonly in women than in men. Same sort of thing. 

HOWEVER, it's very important to understand that there are many reasons WHY 
someone would want to kill multiple people and someone doesn't need to be 
either psychopathic or sociopathic for it to happen. For example, in my 
town of Seattle there was a female serial killer by the name of Dr. Linda 
Hazzard (I highly recommend looking her up if you're interested in serial 
killers :) ) who was not either, but a woman who genuinely believed in her 
own quackery and had a love of money. She ended up accidently killing 
herself with her own treatment the way she used to kill others.
comments.author: longtail4711

comments.text:
+H Ritter Hello. Some people (can't be bothered to scroll up and find the 
names, apologies) touched on some subjects to do with this. The differing 
testosterone/ serotonin levels and the XYY chromosomes for eg, as well as 
the early abuse and the nature vs. nurture debate. It's none and all of 
these things. Male and female physiologies are different, including the way 
that their brains work. I am generalising here. Men tend to have certain 
parts of their brain hardwired to respond to things differently- for 
example, the parts of the human brain that recognise a threat tend to be 
more sensitive in men than women, and usually elicits a more aggressive 
response which is the responsibility of another part of the brain. 
Testosterone plays a huge part in this. Women with high testosterone levels 
tend to be more aggressive (there was recently a study showing that drunk 
women became violent/ aggressive because the alcohol was raising their 
testosterone levels). So, there are subtle differences in hormonal and 
neurological interplay here between men and women. Now the nurture part. 
There are numerous schools of psychological thought here, but I'll try and 
give a very brief overview. There's a stereotypical view of serial killers 
as having being brought up in houses with an overbearing abusive mother and 
a distant or abusive father. There is some truth to this. As boys begin to 
mature and they awaken to sexual urges and the like, they are incredibly 
sensitive at this point. An incident that happens in these initial phases 
can have long bearing influences on a mans sexual psyche. This is how many 
fetishes take life. If a parent were to catch the boy pleasuring himself, 
and make the child feel shame for his actions, punishing him, this is 
considered one of the key motivations for sexual based crimes. There are 
other indicators in childhood- the Macdonald triangle? Bedwetting (this is 
tied into the shame a child is made to feel) pyromania/arson (the discovery 
that this act makes them feel powerful and important as they created and 
controlled it) and hurting animals/ younger children (again, the control 
over something, only a living thing, something that becomes their 
'plaything' which is too powerless to fight back) That is not to say that 
everyone who did any of these instantly becomes a serial killer, it is 
simply a progression that, coupled and mixed with hundreds of other 
variables, including the biolgical basis, can cause a person to become a 
'classic' serial killer, and these things tend to be more common in men 
than women. So, nature vs. nurture = The genetics can set you up to be more 
predisposed to violence, and little incidents throughout a persons life can 
accumulatively add up before a trigger pushes you into full blown serial 
killer mode. While women do sometimes become serial killers, the specifics 
that lead to that tend to be more prevalent in men, with women more likely 
to commit other types of crimes, or commit serial murders for different 
motivations. Feel free to reply back if you'd like to know more. I'd 
consider myself to be a fairly informative source on this. If not, I hope 
this has at least made for interesting reading. I'll stop there, I could go 
on all day (in fact I did when I undertook this subject for a research 
project) so apologies for the massively long comment!

comments.text:
+ChivKnight
Actually, Chiv, your definitions are lack luster.  A serial killer is 
someone who has multiple episodes of killing.  A mass murderer kills many 
people in a single occurrence.  And most importantly, someone who kills a 
string of people on one episode without picking the mantle back up later is 
a spree killer.  For example: a man who kills three kids, takes a year off, 
then kills a young girl is a serial killer.  Someone who kills seven 
families at a church is a mass murderer; Someone who kills 8 girls over 
three months is a spree killer.
It's important to know the difference :)

comments.text:
+Skyedashie Fye
You're misunderstanding. No one cares if you like creepypasta or gore or 
anything. The thing is that these are real people who were violently 
murdered by psychotic men and you're playing it off like it's just a cute 
fake story that no one got hurt from.

Jeff the Killer, Slenderman, Paranormal Activity- those aren't real. That's 
fine. But what it sounded like you were saying basically was "Oh, Ted Bundy 
was cool! I'm glad he killed all those women." which comes off as 
insensitive and cruel. (and that was just an example of what it sounded 
like you said, not the actual thing. please don't reply to me saying 
something like "I never said Ted Bundy!" or anything..)

Now, there's a difference between liking what the serial killers did and 
being intrigued by who the killers were and why they'd do such a horrible 
thing. Historians are interested in the history, they do not support the 
act themselves as a "mere fun gore story".

But, you know what? You can like serial killers if you want, you can be 
happy they killed innocent people if you'd like. (It's you're life, no one 
has control over you.) But just know that everyone else is going to think 
you're crazy and probably criticize you for it. In that case, you should 
just take it like an adult and go on.

+David Gugsa It's usually a combination of three things:

Psychopathy
Abuse as a child
A natural tendency towards sexual sadism.

Psychopathy means, effectively, that you will not experience empathy. 
Empathy is one of the biggest deterrents to deviant behavior. If you lack 
it, all sorts of options open up.

Abuse as a child is a demonstration of how human beings - even the most 
vulnerable, i.e. children - are to be treated.

Sexual sadism is a pleasure obtained by inflicting pain on others.

Put them together and you get people like in the video.

comments.text:
+RedSkull HAX Not necessarily. Serial murder isn't a numbers game. A mob 
enforcer, for example, could kill dozens and never be considered a serial 
killer. A serial killer is (as the name implies) defined by a *series*. The 
"3 or more" thing only really matters if the victims were part of a 
contiguous series specific to the killer's *personal* and likely irrational 
motive. This is, in part, why the FBI goes by 2, if the rest fits.

comments.author: Breanne Doria

comments.text:
H. H. Holmes is the alias used by Herman Webster Mudgett during much of his 
infamous murder spree; it is estimated that he may have killed two to three 
hundred people between 1886 and 1894, most of them during the Chicago 
World's Fair in 1893.  He built a block-long three story hotel over a drug 
store that has been dubbed the "Murder Castle" and included secret 
passages, rooms he could seal off and gas, vats of acid, abattoirs, and a 
thriving business selling the bones and cadavers of his victims to medical 
schools, hospitals, and research centers.  He was also a thorough liar and 
con artist, and thus it is difficult to know how much of what he claimed 
was true or not.  Only 9 deaths were confirmed, and he confessed to 27, but 
there were indications of far more victims, particularly based on records 
of disappearances and other trace evidence.

I don't think we should take away what we cannot give. There are innocent 
prisoners too, after all. Being in prison for 20 years while being innocent 
is hard enough, but being killed too... That's just horrible. And criminals 
aren't monsters. Most of them are people who either grew up under bad 
circumstances or did something they otherwise wouldn't do. I don't know 
what I'm capable of doing if I'm set under the right (or wrong) 
circumstances. Does that make me a horrible person who deserves to die?

captions.text:
• From crazy clown killers butchering small
children, to the man who killed his own father

and ate his heart, we count 15 of the most
dangerous, psychopathic murderers we've ever

had the misfortune to hear about
15 - Jeffrey Dahmer

• An American serial killer from Milwaukee
- he would lead men to his apartment and dismember

their bodies, keeping their skulls as souvenirs
• He did this a total of 17 times and was

actually known to eat parts of his victims
from time to time

• Luckily, his final would-be victim escaped,
managed to flag down a police car passing

on the road and Jeffrey was sentenced to 900
years jail, but was found dead at prison in

1994
14 - Moses Sithole

• Seen as one of the most infamous serial
killers of South Africa, he began what was

known as the "ABC Murders" since his murders
began in a town starting with A, Atteridgeville,

then moved to Boksburg and finally Cleveland
• He would lead victims into abandoned fields

and overpower them, usually involving rape
and subsequently death

• After he was captured in 1995, his sentence
was set to over 2,000 years with possible

parole in just under 1,000 years
• Good chance he won't live that long

13 - Ted Bundy
• Complete maniac who disguised himself

as a charismatic, somewhat friendly kind of
guy

• He would often kidnap women, posing as
an authority figure or a disabled man to catch

them off guard, but then sometimes he got
so impatient he would just boot down your

door and stab you in the face while you sleep,
then rape and cut off your head as a souvenir

• He was captured in 1979 and ten years
later sentenced to the electric chair

12 - Pedro Filho
• This guy is intense, and he comes from

a history of terrible violence that shaped
the man himself

• Before Pedro was even born, his father
beat his mother and caused him a head injury,

then, by the time Pedro turned 18 years of
age, he had killed 10 people

• Then he killed his father and ate pieces
of his heart before getting sent to prison,

where he killed more than 70 people
• Because Brazil has maximum sentencing,

Pedro was released in 2007 and is still around
to this day

11 - Dennis Nilsen
• This guy was lonely, but in all the wrong

ways - he lured over 15 young men and boys
to his flat in London between 1978 and 1983,

killed them and slept with them in his bed
because he wanted company

• He would dispose of the decomposing corpses
by burning them or flushing bits of them down

the toilet
• He was caught because a plumber found

human flesh in the pipes, so Nilsen was arrested
and jailed for life

10 - Daniel Camargo
• This guy was a child-murderer with over

150 victims, usually young virgin girls
• He only confessed to killing 72 people

though, but was jailed, then he escaped from
jail and went around killing even MORE people

in Ecuador, but he was rearrested in 1989
and killed in jail

• It is believed he might've been motivated
to murder due to his stepmother who abused

him as a child
9 - Joachim Kroll

• This one comes in from Germany, a man
who killed and ate 13 people including small

children
• Police got so desperate to catch him that

they went knocking door-to-door asking if
anyone had seen him before, and they got lucky

when someone in Kroll's building pointed out
guts had been jamming plumbing pipes

• It turned out Kroll had been slicing flesh
off victims and cooking them to save on grocery

bills
• Thankfully, his heart exploded in jail

around 1991
8 - Henry Lee Lucas

• This guy originally came forward to say
he and his accomplice, Ottis Toole, had slaughtered

thousands of people
• In actuality though, police suspected

him of only killing around 200, but only 4
of which were ever proven - bizarrely, George

W. Bush stepped up as Governor at the time
to change his death sentence to life in prison

• Lucas died on natural causes at the age
of 64, and we never really found out why George

showed this strange generosity
7 - John Wayne Gacy

• Also known as the "Killer Clown", he was
originally arrested for sexually assaulting

two teenage boys, but later released
• He then enjoyed dressing up as "Pogo the

Clown" volunteering at parades and parties,
but then we find out he killed 33 young boys,

burying their bodies in his yard, the river
and near his house

• He was later arrested once again, where
he confessed to his heinous crimes

6 - Luis Garavito
• This took place in Columbia, and it's

the subject of MUCH debate, as well as an
ongoing documentary

• In 1999, he was arrested and convicted
of killing at least 140 children which would

lead to a several hundred year imprisonment,
except the Columbian justice system has a

maximum penalty of 30-40 years
• Because he was very co-operative and apologetic,

his sentence was reduced to 22 years, but
a public outcry is continuously preventing

this from taking place
5 - Peter Sutcliffe

• Also known as the "Yorkshire Ripper",
who went on a five year rampage to murder

around 13 women in the late 70s
• Most were prostitutes who he hit with

hammers, stabbed and then sexually assault
just before they die

• He was only caught because he happened
to be driving through the red-light district

and a police patrolmen recognised his registration
plates

4 - Pedro Lopez
• He's often called the "Monster of the

Andes", a man who murdered and raped young
girls aged between 8 and 12

• He was arrested in 1980 and was later
convicted of killing 110 girls, even though

he confessed to over 300 total kills
• In 1998 he was released on a $50 bail,

and now his current whereabouts are unknown
3 - Gilles De Rais

• A bit of an old one, from the 1400s the
celebrated military captain in the army of

St Joan of Arc, who later turned to a life
of crime

• He would lure young boys to his castle
with the promise of sweets, then torture and

mutilate them in deeply inhumane ways
• His greatest pleasure was to bathe in

their own blood, to stab them in the jugular
and allow warm blood to wash over him

• His servants would then burn the bodies
- pretty sickening stuff

2 - Andrei Chikatilo
• One of the more notorious serial murderers

from Ukraine, the "Ripper of Rostov", who
had a strange fetish - that he could only

get off by stabbing and slashing victims instead
of raping them

• He spent 20 years free, butchering at
least 50 people in the early 90s before he

was arrested, then executed via gunshot at
57 years of age

1 - Gary Ridgeway
• This man known as the "Green River Killer"

murdered 71 women over the course of around
10 years

• He would pick up prostitutes and strangle
them cold, then dump their bodies in the Green

River, hence his nickname
• He eluded the police for quite a while
before they picked him up in 2001

title: 15 Worst Serial Killers of All Time
